title: Navigation
text:
Vehicle Kinematics



The autonomous ground vehicle has a circular frame

The radius of the circular frame is r=0.1r = 0.1m.

The pose of the vehicle w.r.t. the world {0}\{0\} is below figure.

Œ∏\theta: angle the axis xrx_r makes with the axis x0x_0.
(x,y)(x, y): components of the vector that connects the origins of frames {0}\{0\} and {R}\{R\} starting from {0}\{0\}, resolved in frame {0}\{0\}.



 ŒæR‚àº0ùêìR=(cosŒ∏‚àísinŒ∏xsinŒ∏cosŒ∏y001). {\xi}_R \sim {^0}\bm{T}_R = \begin{pmatrix} \cos{\theta} & -\sin{\theta} & x
\\ \sin{\theta} & \cos{\theta} & y \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}. 



The translational velocity vv of the vehicle is purely along the x‚àíx- axis.
The angular velocity of œâ\omega of the vehicle is purely along the z‚àíz- axis.
Thinking of vv and œâ\omega as the inputs to the system, its kinematics is given by

xÃá=vcosŒ∏,yÃá=vsinŒ∏,Œ∏Ãá=œâ.
\begin{aligned}
\dot{x} &= v \cos{\theta}, \\
\dot{y} &= v \sin{\theta}, \\
\dot{\theta} &= \omega.
\end{aligned}

title: Navigation
text:
Map

¬†

The bottom-right corner is the origin of the world frame {0}\{0\}.
The map is of a 22m-by-22m room, with separators (walls) of thickness Œ¥=0.01m=1cm\delta = 0.01\,\text{m} = 1\,\text{cm}.
The two corridors have width Œµ=0.3m=30cm\varepsilon = 0.3\,\text{m} = 30\,\text{cm}.

Each corridor have a clearance of 12\frac{1}{2}\,m from the walls they face.
The width of the corridors fits 1.51.5 autonomous ground vehicles.

The map is static and is known by the robot.

title: Navigation
text:
Problem Statement
¬†



Take a simulation time of Œ¥t=0.1\delta t = 0.1\,s.
Create an RRT tree.
Find a path that takes the robot from the initial configuration qs=(541460‚àò)‚ä§q_s = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{5}{4} & \frac{1}{4} & 60^\circ \end{pmatrix}^\top to the goal configuration q‚òÖ=(2‚àíŒµ20‚àí90‚àò)‚ä§q_\bigstar = \begin{pmatrix} 2-\frac{\varepsilon}{2} & 0 & -90^\circ \end{pmatrix}^\top.
Submit your solution and the created RRT tree as a plot or as a simulation.
